topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack 2.0: Adding a New Ceph Monitor Node

body.p: In HP Helion OpenStack 2.0, a Ceph monitor node is installed on the Controller nodes by default. A new monitor node cannot be added to an existing Ceph cluster, if Ceph is deployed with the default configuration. However, if monitor nodes are added on a dedicated resource node, then you can add a new monitor node.
If a monitor resource is not already defined, you will need to first define one and then add the new monitor node. For instructions, see .

p.b: To Add a New Monitor Node

body.p:
Perform the following procedure to add a new monitor node to an existing Ceph cluster:
Login to the Deployer/lifecycle-manager node.
Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/servers.yml file to define a new monitor node as shown below:- id: mon4 ip-addr: 192.168.10.11 role: MON-ROLE server-group: RACK3 nic-mapping: MY-2PORT-SERVER mac-addr: 8b:f6:9e:ca:3b:7a ilo-ip: 192.168.9.11 ilo-password: password ilo-user: adminSubstitute the values in above sample as per your environment for the server being added.
Commit your configuration: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "Added monitor node {node-id}"Replace the {node-id} in the commit message with appropriate value (for example, mon4).
Run the following command:cd ~/helion/hos/ansible/ ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost cobbler-deploy.yml
To reimage all the nodes using PXE, run the following command:ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost bm-reimage.yml
Run the configuration processor:ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Use the playbook below to create a deployment directory: ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Run the following commands:
cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts guard-deployment.yml ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts osconfig-run.yml ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts ceph-deploy.yml
If you want the new compute node to be included in the monitoring service checks, there is an additional playbook that must be run to ensure this happens: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts monasca-deploy.yml --tags active_ping_checks
The new monitor node is deployed in an existing Ceph cluster.

p.b: To Verify the Newly-Added Monitor Node

body.p: From the Deployer/lifecycle-manager node, run the following command:ceph --cluster ceph -f json quorum_statusIf the Ceph cluster name is different than the default (i.e. ceph), you need to modify the above command accordingly.
The newly-added monitor's host name appears in the quorum_names section of the output of above command.
